Articles.Content:
The Introduction!

So I'm going to be attempting the Elcano challenge on Kerbin real quickly, with my goal being to stick to a strict equatorial route. The entire event will be live-streamed over the course of several days (notices will be posted here as well as in other places).

The Vehicle!

The vehicle used will be a heavily modified version of Jon144's Mega Truck 2. He has approved of the usage of his vehicle for the task and even plans on filming some of the streams to use for his youtube channel. This challenge should be a good test for his wheel and suspension systems. The base version of the truck has been cleared for up to 45 degree slopes, which should make mountains less of a problem for me.

> ![94BA3C8CBF03F130A41585D98BC7F7600FD1B9B1](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436074295020378658/94BA3C8CBF03F130A41585D98BC7F7600FD1B9B1/)

Problems have arisen, mainly due to lag issues. I likely will be designing my own home-built vehicle for the challenge instead sadly

The Twitch Channel!

[http://www.twitch.tv/noname117spore](http://www.twitch.tv/noname117spore)

Stream Status!

Not streaming

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-12T21:58:58Z" title="08/12/2015 09:58  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 12, 2015</time> by Noname117**

Under 500 parts is not laggy. You need to make sure that you have your physics delta set properly. And don't add on unnecessary parts. My truck is the ultimate vehicle ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

You just don't seem to have patience to make something that works.
